TopicTitle: Is there any obvious conflicts in my mod list?

Articles.Content:
I will say that I am playing on x64 (because obviously), and I do realize that it isn't completely stable. However, I have a strong feeling that some of the crashes I'm experiencing may actually have more to do with the mods I'm currently using rather than x64 itself (mostly because until a lot of different mods updated, my x64 install was actually pretty stable despite packing in an amount of mods that isn't much less than what I'm going with now).

But anyway, if there aren't any obvious issues between my mods, then so be it. But if there is, I'd like to try and resolve them to see if it solves my problems before I resign this whole issue to x64 just being unstable.

Here's a screen of my GameData

I have already went through several of the mods (namely FASA and B9) to cut out a lot of the redundant parts (or things that I just plain never use), so the list isn't as overloaded as it looks.

*sigh*

First off, there are almost no cases of conflicts between KSP mods, and for the few there are, nobody knows them off hand well enough to glance at a list and say so.

Second off, as has been repeated endlessly here, x64 is broken. Horribly broken. Having it randomly decide to work or not is perfectly within it's capability, and it seems it's decided it doesn't like you today.

Some potential solutions:

-cut out even more parts (x64 may work if you can get the memory usage low enough)

-try to get x32 working with Active Texture Management

-Read this thread which seems to have had some success

-sacrifice kerbals to the kraken and hope he is merciful and allows x64 to work
